CHARLIE SMITH, CPM

City Manager

– The City Manager serves as chief administrative and executive officer of the City and assures that all laws and city ordinances are enforced; and does related work as required. The City Manager appoints and removes all heads of departments and all subordinate officers and employees of the City, except as otherwise provided in the City Charter. The City Manager exercises control over all departments and subdivisions thereof created by the City Charter and City Council. The City Manager attends all meetings of the City Council, taking part in discussions and recommending Council action as appropriate and keeps the Council fully advised as to the financial condition and needs of the City. The City Manager assures the annual budget is prepared and submitted to the City Council and assures that the City operates within its budget. The City Manager executes deeds and contracts on behalf of the City when authorized by ordinance, resolution or motion of the City Council. The City Manager also represents the City in professional and civic organizations and serves as the Gladewater Municipal Airport Manager.

![](https://cityofgladewater.com/api/blob/viewBlob?rf=t&i=AuXoBKyJDXO0KQteeX9oX%2FiyKu2DpzTcmfqPlpvA8HUWEUqPoNMAzKii%2FZ%2Fabvhx&s=large)

JUDY VANHOUTEN, TRMC

City Secretary

(903) 845-2196 x4

Email

– The City Secretary gives notice of all official meetings, keeps the journal and minute books of their proceedings, authenticates by her signature and record in full, in a book kept for that purpose, all ordinances and resolutions.  She prepares and posts meeting agendas for the Council and all City Boards according to the Open Meetings Act.  The City Secretary serves as the election official for all City elections, general and special.  She is the custodian of the official city seal and attests the mayor’s signature on all official documents and performs all other duties required by charter or by ordinance.

– Judy is a 1987 Graduate of Gladewater High School.  With the exception of 12 years spent in the Dallas area, Judy is a lifelong resident of Gladewater.  She has worked for the City of Gladewater since 2009 and was appointed City Clerk in April 2018.  Her son, Brian and step-daughter, Holly are her biggest fans.  When not attending to city business she loves to read, crochet and spend time with her family.

![](https://cityofgladewater.com/api/blob/viewBlob?rf=t&i=mk%252BYOCx8ZehYDBJXJLR4lDJ%2FmbZh73XczcyTyIqdPPEZ62Xqu%252BKt5UXNxbpZH2wG&s=large)

MEGHAN FOSTER, MAcc, CPM

City Treasurer / HR Director

c.
(903) 374-5671

w.
(903) 845-2196 x8

Email

The City Treasurer & HR Director directly oversees the city's financial activities under the administrative leadership of the City Manager. They take full responsibility for the municipality's accounting and fiscal functions, working in close partnership with the City Manager and various departments to ensure rigorous monitoring of financial responsibilities. Their role encompasses managing the city's budget, cash flow, investment activities, and conducting city audits. Additionally, they effectively supervise the Utility Billing Department, Municipal Court, and Finance Department. Moreover, this position is fundamentally responsible for the administration and strategic direction of the Human Resources function. They manage labor relations, oversee training, enforce job classification and pay structures, administer benefits, and lead a range of other HR activities. It is imperative that they maintain the integrity and confidentiality of departmental records and employee documentation at all times.
